intro: Abuta, commonly known as the "Garden of the Gods," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Abuta species often grow as shrubs or small trees, and they are known for their ornamental value in horticulture. Some species are also valued for their medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
